intro: Taraxacum atrochlorinum, commonly known as the black-chlorophyll dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its dark green, hairy leaves and yellow composite flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant is native to Europe and is often found in grassy areas and disturbed soils. It has a robust root system that allows it to thrive in various environmental conditions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
